content: The Act may be cited as the "Commercial Motor Vehicle Advanced Safety Technology Tax Act of 2007". Congress finds that commercial motor vehicle crashes are a major concern in the United States, especially with the increasing number of trucks and their role in transporting hazardous materials. A 2004 report showed that truck crashes are more likely to result in fatalities compared to passenger cars. In 2005, large truck-related crashes caused 5,212 deaths and 114,000 injuries in the US. These crashes also have a significant economic cost, with highway crashes costing society $230.6 billion annually.
